Connie Okasaki is a PhD candidate at the University of Washington, an NSF Graduate Research Fellow, an ARCS Fellow, and a Pre-Doctoral Instructor. She has taught Introduction to Probability and Statistics and Introduction to Quantitative Ecology at the undergraduate and graduate levels. She has an excellent academic record, and glowing reviews from her time as an instructor. She is passionate about teaching and is trained in evidence-based and equity-focused teaching strategies in the NSF-funded STEP-UP program at UW. Her priority is providing a comfortable and compassionate learning environment for her students.
